title: Misleading error messages in presence of unnecessary `createFactory`
body:
When porting non-JSX React code, e.g. CoffeeScript, to JSX and forgetting to remove unnecessary `createFactory` calls, the following warnings / errors are issued which (seemingly) are unrelated to the root cause:

```
Warning: bound scrollValueMonitor(...): No `render` method found on the
returned component instance: you may have forgotten to define `render` in
your component or you may have accidentally tried to render an element
whose type is a function that isn't a React component.

Warning: Don't set the props property of the React element.
Instead, specify the correct value when initially creating the element.

TypeError: Can't add property context, object is not extensible
at ReactCompositeComponentMixin.mountComponent (react.js:6339:18)
    at wrapper [as mountComponent] (react.js:13427:21)
    at Object.ReactReconciler.mountComponent (react.js:14128:35)
    at mountComponentIntoNode (react.js:12038:32)
    at ReactReconcileTransaction.Mixin.perform (react.js:16683:20)
    at batchedMountComponentIntoNode (react.js:12059:15)
    at ReactDefaultBatchingStrategyTransaction.Mixin.perform (react.js:16683:20)
    at Object.ReactDefaultBatchingStrategy.batchedUpdates (react.js:9199:19)
    at Object.batchedUpdates (react.js:14914:20)
    at Object.ReactMount._renderNewRootComponent (react.js:12194:18)
```
### Repro

https://jsbin.com/vetoqi/2/edit?html,js,console
### Source

Originally noted in https://github.com/oncletom/Imager.jsx/issues/12, but if you google

```
No `render` method found on the returned component instance
```

many other potential related issues show up.
